meanings.definition: The quality or state of being naive.
meanings.sent1: Her naivenesses led her to trust everyone she met.
meanings.sent2: His naivenesses made him an easy target for scams.
meanings.sent3: Despite her naivenesses, she always had a positive outlook on life.
meanings.sent4: The world of politics can quickly strip away one's naivenesses.
meanings.sent5: The child's naivenesses were endearing to all who knew her.

meanings.definition: The lack of experience, judgment, or sophistication.
meanings.sent1: His naivenesses in the business world often resulted in costly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The criminal took advantage of her naivenesses to deceive her.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the naivenesses of his own youth.
meanings.sent4: In the harsh reality of the streets, naivenesses can be dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The detective relied on his partner's naivenesses to solve the case.
